Description:
DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS EPA AWARD IS TO ENABLE THE NORTHWEST INDIAN FISHERIES COMMISSION (NWIFC) TO SERVE AS THE PUGET SOUND ACTION AGENDA TRIBAL IMPLEMENTATION LEAD (TIL 2.0) FOR THREE PRIMARY PURPOSES: (1) MAKE AND MANAGE SUBAWARDS: DEVELOP AND CARRY OUT A SYSTEM FOR MAKING SUBAWARDS TO FEDERALLY-RECOGNIZED TRIBES IN THE PUGET SOUND BASIN AND AUTHORIZED CONSORTIA OF THESE TRIBES; (2) MANAGEMENT CONFERENCE PARTICIPATION AND PARTNER ENGAGEMENT: DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT MECHANISMS FOR ENGAGING WITH MANAGEMENT CONFERENCE AND FUNDING MODEL PARTNERS; AND (3) MANAGE THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT: ADAPTIVELY MANAGE THE TIL 2.0 COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WITH EPA. PLEASE SEE ATTACHED APPLICANT PROPOSED WORKPLAN FOR A COMPLETE DESCRIPTION OF THE WORK TO BE ACCOMPLISHED IN THIS PROJECT, AS WELL AS THE AWARD PURPOSE.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING UNDER THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT FOR THE NORTHWEST INDIAN FISHERIES COMMISSION TO MAKE AND MANAGE SUBAWARDS THAT IMPLEMENT PROJECTS OF HIGH TRIBAL PRIORITY IN THE PUGET SOUND ACTION AGENDA. THE PUGET SOUND ACTION AGENDA SERVES AS THE EPA-APPROVED COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) UNDER SECTION 320 OF THE CLEAN WATER ACT.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES THAT WILL BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS AWARD INCLUDE: DEVELOPING AND ISSUING REQUESTS FOR PROPOSALS (RFPS); MANAGING THE PROPOSAL REVIEW PROCESS; PROVIDING ONGOING ADMINISTRATIVE, TECHNICAL AND PROGRAMMATIC SUPPORT TO SUBRECIPIENT POPULATION; TRACKING AND MONITORING SUBRECIPIENT PERFORMANCE; COORDINATE AND COMMUNICATE EXTERNALLY TO MAXIMIZE INTEGRATION OF BODY OF WORK SUPPORTED UNDER THIS GRANT WITH OTHER KEY EFFORTS TO IMPLEMENT THE ACTION AGENDA AND PROTECT AND RESTORE PUGET SOUND; AND ENSURING THE WORK UNDER THIS AWARD AND UNDER SUBRECIPIENT AWARDS MEETS OUTPUT MILESTONES, OUTCOMES, AND ALL AWARD REQUIREMENTS AND TERMS AND CONDITIONS. THE APPLICANT WILL ALSO SUPPORT ITS SUBRECIPIENTS IN ACCESSING INFORMATION ABOUT OTHER KEY RESOURCES AVAILABLE UNDER FEDERAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND OTHER INITIATIVES; WILL INCREASE THE INTERNAL STRATEGIC COORDINATION AND ALIGNMENT BETWEEN THE TIL 2.0 PROGRAM AND OTHER OF ITS PROGRAMS INVOLVED IN PUGET SOUND PROTECTION AND RESTORATION; AND ADAPTIVELY MANAGING THE TIL 2.0 PROGRAM TO INCORPORATE FEEDBACK FROM SUBRECIPIENTS AS WELL AS SYNTHESIZING LESSONS LEARNED, STRENGTHS, AND OPPORTUNITIES GAINED FROM SERVING AS THE TIL 2.0. SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARDS UNDER THIS PROGRAM WILL IMPLEMENT PROJECTS THAT ARE BOTH IDENTIFIED IN THE PUGET SOUND ACTION AGENDA AS WELL AS THAT ARE OF HIGH TRIBAL PRIORITY. THE ACTION AGENDA COMPRISES A WIDE RANGE OF STRATEGIES AND ACTIONS TO PROTECT AND RESTORE A HEALTHY AND RESILIENT PUGET SOUND. THERE ARE 31 STRATEGIES AND 138 ACTIONS IN THE ACTION AGENDA. EXAMPLES OF STRATEGIES INCLUDE WORKING LANDS, HEALTHY SHORELINES, RIPARIAN AREAS, FLOODPLAINS AND ESTUARIES, TOXIC CHEMICAL POLLUTION, WORKING LANDS RUNOFF, RESPONSIBLE BOATING, AND CLIMATE ADAPTATION AND RESILIENCE. ALL SUBAWARDS WILL BE RELATED TO ADVANCING THE STRATEGIES AND ACTIONS IN THE ACTION AGENDA.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE:
  - PROPOSAL CYCLE PROCESS, TIMELINES, AND IMPLEMENTATION
  - DRAFT AND FINAL RFPS
  - PROJECT FILES FOR ALL SUBRECIPIENT PROPOSALS, DOCUMENTING FEEDBACK AND RESPONSES; QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLANS (QAPPS)
  - SUBRECIPIENT COMMUNICATION MATERIALS ENSURING SUBRECIPIENTS ARE AWARE OF SUBAWARD REQUIREMENTS
  - COMPILATIONS OF MATERIALS RELATING TO OTHER RESOURCES, SUCH AS INFRASTRUCTURE LAW FUNDING, RELEVANT TO SUBRECIPIENT PROJECTS
  - SUBRECIPIENT PROGRESS REPORTS
  - SUBRECIPIENT SITE VISIT REPORTS COMPLETED
  - ACTIVE ENGAGEMENT AT ACTION AGENDA, MANAGEMENT CONFERENCE, AWARD COORDINATION GROUP, AND OTHER KEY EXTERNAL COORDINATION FORUMS
  - MATERIALS FOR COMMUNICATING TIL 2.0 PROGRAM 
  - SYNTHESIS, ANALYSIS, AND EVALUATION PRODUCTS DEVELOPED FROM SUBRECIPIENT FEEDBACK AND BODY OF WORK
OUTCOMES IDENTIFIED IN THE APPLICANT'S WORKPLAN INCLUDE:
  - TRIBES SUSTAIN T

THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE SKAGIT RIVER SYSTEM COOPERATIVE TO PROVIDE PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION OF ACTIONS THAT PROTECT AND RESTORE CRITICAL HABITATS.  COMPONENT 1) REGIONAL AND LOCAL ACTION PLAN IMPLEMENTATION. THIS WORK INVOLVES ENGAGEMENT WITH LOCAL AND REGIONAL PLANNING WITH THE LEAD ENTITY'S THROUGHOUT THE WHIDBEY BASIN DRAINAGE AREA, AND LEAD INTEGRATING ORGANIZATION. WORK ALSO INCLUDES OUTREACH AND NEGOTIATION WITH AGENCIES AND INDIVIDUAL LANDOWNERS TO SUPPORT DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF HIGH PRIORITY RESTORATION PROJECTS.

THIS FUNDING WILL SUPPORT PUYALLUP TRIBE'S PROPOSAL THAT INCLUDE. 1) COLD WATER REFUGE INVESTIGATION OF PRIORITY SPAWNING AND REARING TRIBUTARIES.  2) BENTHIC INVERTEBRATE SURVEYS OF SPAWNING AND REARING TRIBUTARIES.  3) AMBIENT WATER QUALITY MONITORING ON RESERVATION WITHIN USUAL AREA FISHING. 4) SALT WEDGE MONITORING OF COASTAL STREAMS. 5) IMPROVING TECHNICAL CAPACITY TO DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT HABITAT RESTORATION PROJECTS. 6) MULTI-BENEFIT RESTORATION PLANNING WITH WATERSHED PARTNERS ON THE LOWER WHITE RIVER AND CLEAR CREEK, TRIBUTARY TO THE LOWER PUYALLUP RIVER.

THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE NISQUALLY INDIAN TRIBE TO PARTICIPATION IN PROCESSES SEEKING TO DEVELOP A COMMON UNDERSTANDING OF WHAT IS REQUIRED TO RESTORE THE HEALTH OF THE PUGET SOUND ECOSYSTEM, A STRATEGY TO ACHIEVE THE DESIRED OBJECTIVE AND THE IDENTIFICATION OF THE KEY ACTIONS REQUIRED TO IMPLEMENT THAT STRATEGY SUCCESSFULLY. THE ACTION AGENDA FOCUS ON THE IMPROVEMENT IN THE ECOSYSTEM AS A WHOLE AND THE HARVESTABLE SURPLUS OF SALMON, APPROVED SHELLFISH GROWING WATERS, AND CONTAMINANTS IN SEAFOOD THAT DO NOT JEOPARDIZE THE HEALTH OF THE NISQUALLY INDIAN TRIBE.

THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS THE TRIBE TO PARTICIPATE IN REGIONAL AND LOCAL VITAL SIGN RECOVERY ACTIONS TOWARDS PUGET SOUND PARTNERSHIPS GOALS. THE TRIBE WILL PARTICIPATE IN LOCAL AND REGIONAL RESOURCE PLANNING AND MANAGEMENT COMMITTEES, MONITOR, TRACK IMPLEMENTATION OF CONSERVATION ACTIONS AIMED AT PROTECTING AND RESTORING FISHERY RESOURCES IN PUGET SOUND. 1) HABITAT RESTORATION AND PROTECTION OF FRESHWATER ECOSYSTEMS. 2) PARTICIPATE IN EFFORTS TO RESTORE FRESHWATER CONNECTIVITY AND CLIMATE RESILIENCY. 3) DEVELOP AND FOSTER LOCAL HABITAT RESTORATION AND PROTECTION PROJECT PARTNERSHIPS.

THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS THE STILLAGUAMISH TRIBE TO PARTICIPATE IN PUGET SOUND PARTNERSHIP CONFERENCE ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING LOCAL WATERSHED AND TECHNICAL ADVISORY GROUPS. OUTREACH AND EDUCATION ARE IMPORTANT COMPONENTS TO ONGOING RECOVERY PROJECTS TO WORK CLOSELY WITH THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE LANDOWNERS. EVENTS HELP CREATE AWARENESS AND PROTECTIVE BEHAVIOR FOR THIS REGION'S NATURAL RESOURCES FROM CLIMATE CHANGE AND PROTECTION OF SALMON HABITAT. TRIBAL RESILIENCE IS RELATED TO CLIMATE CHANGE. THIS INFORMATION WILL GUIDE MANAGER PLANNING TO DEVELOP RESILIENCE TO ECOSYSTEM AND RESOURCE CHANGES.

THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS OUR GOAL TO CONSULT GOVERNMENT TO GOVERNMENT TO IMPROVE THE OPERATIONAL MANDATE OF THE PUGET SOUND PARTNERSHIP THROUGH ADDRESSING OBSTACLES THAT LEAD AGENCIES POSE THE SUCCESS OF THE PARTNERSHIP. STRATEGY FOR WORKING TOWARDS THESE OBJECTIVES INCLUDE: 1) PROTECT TREATY RESOURCES FROM OIL POLLUTION, 2) IMPROVE VESSEL TRAFFIC SAFETY, SPILL PREVENTION MEASURES, 3) ADDRESS CLIMATE CHANGE, OCEAN, ENVIRONMENTAL THREATS AND OPPORTUNITIES, 4) BUILD CAPACITY AND INFRASTRUCTURE TO SUPPORT TREATY RESOURCE PROTECTION AND MAKAH TRIBAL COUNCIL PRIORITIES.

THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS THE SQUAXIN ISLAND TRIBE TO SUPPORT ACTIVE PARTICIPATION IN PUGET SOUND RECOVERY EFFORTS THROUGH MEETINGS AND EVENTS AND GRANT WRITING.  WE HAVE CREATED AND CONTRIBUTED TO NUMEROUS PLANNING AND STRATEGIC DOCUMENTS. THIS FUNDING IS USED TO SUPPORT COHO SALMON PLANTS INTO THE DESCHUTES RIVER.  THIS IS A COLLABORATIVE STUDY WITH WASHINGTON DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE, SO CRITICAL MASS OF COHO SMOLTS AND RETURNING ADULT FISH TO STUDY MARINE SURVIVAL.

THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE LUMMI NATION TO PARTICIPATE IN PROCESSES SEEKING TO DEVELOP A COMMON UNDERSTANDING OF WHAT IS REQUIRED TO RESTORE THE HEALTH OF THE PUGET SOUND ECOSYSTEM, A STRATEGY TO ACHIEVE THE DESIRED OBJECTIVE AND THE IDENTIFICATION OF THE KEY ACTIONS REQUIRED TO IMPLEMENT THAT STRATEGY SUCCESSFULLY. WE WILL FOCUS ON THE ACTION AGENDA AND IMPROVEMENT IN THE ECOSYSTEM AS A WHOLE AND THE HARVESTABLE SURPLUS OF SALMON, APPROVED SHELLFISH GROWING WATERS, AND CONTAMINANTS IN SEAFOOD THAT DO NOT JEOPARDIZE THE HEALTH OF THE LUMMI COMMUNITY.

THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS THE SNOQUALMIE TRIBE TO PARTICIPATE IN THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PUGET SOUND ACTION AGENDA.  TASKS INCLUDE:  DATA COLLECTION, GATHERING, COORDINATION AND ANALYSIS; IDENTIFICATION OF DATA GAPS, PRIORITIZATION OF PROJECTS.  STAFF WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR PARTICIPATING IN LOCAL AND REGIONAL WATERSHED PLANNING AND MANAGEMENT PROCESSES, RELATED MEETINGS AND PLANNING EFFORTS AND IMPLEMENTING A MONITORING PROGRAM; INCLUDING COLLECTION, COMPILING, SHARING OF WATER QUALITY DATA, HABITAT DATA, KNOWLEDGE RELATED TO HABIT RESTORATION PROJECTS

THIS PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON DEVELOPING THE CAPACITY TO PARTICIPATE IN LOCAL AND REGIONAL EFFORTS TO ADDRESS PRIORITY ACTION AGENDA ISSUES IN THE HOOD CANAL AND STRAIT OF JUAN DE FUCA ACTION AREAS. THE TRIBE WILL PARTICIPATE IN LOCAL ACTION AREA PROCESSES THAT WORK TO PROTECT AND RECOVER LOCAL AND REGIONAL SALMON, FORAGE FISH AND SHELLFISH POPULATIONS. WE WILL CONTINUE TO PARTICIPATE IN PRIORITIZING EFFORTS WITH THE HOOD CANAL COORDINATING COUNCIL LEAD INITIATIVES ORGANIZATION AND THE STRAITS ENVIRONMENTAL RECOVERY NETWORK AND THE STRATEGIC INITIATIVES ADVISORY TEAMS FOR THESE ACTION AREAS.

FUNDING WILL SUPPORT WATERSHED TECHNICAL AND POLICY ADVISORY GROUPS, ASSOCIATED WORKGROUPS AND SUB-COMMITTEES, ENHANCED TECHNICAL CAPACITY TO REVIEW RECOVERY PROJECTS. ALSO, SUPPORT MEMBERSHIP ON CORE TEAMS, LOCAL INTEGRATING FOR THE WHIDBEY ACTION AREAS.  BUILD CAPACITY TO FACILITATE COORDINATION ON ISSUES RELATED TO RECOVERY STRATEGIES IN THE ACTION AGENDA. IN ADDITION, THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ENHANCE TULALIP'S ABILITY TO REVIEW PERMITS, INCREASE CAPACITY DEDICATED TO TECHNICAL REVIEW, EVALUATION RESEARCH AND SCIENTIFIC GAPS TULALIP CAN FILL BY LEVERAGING ITS LEADERSHIP.

THIS WORKPLAN SUPPORTS HOW THE TREATY COUNCIL, WORKING IN CONJUNCTION WITH ITS TRIBES AND OTHER LOCAL ENTITIES, CAN PROVIDE NEEDED COORDINATION OF TRIBAL ACTIVITIES AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT BY ADDRESSING HABITAT PROTECTION AND OTHER ACTIONS THAT ADDRESS PRIORITY ISSUES AND ACTIONS IN THE PARTNERSHIP'S ACTION AGENDA. IT ALSO FOCUSES ON ACTIVITIES RELEVANT TO CURRENT PUGET SOUND RECOVERY ACTIONS THAT ARE LIKELY TO CONTINUE TO EXIST OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL YEARS. AS PROGRESS IS MADE, LESSONS ARE LEARNED, AND THE ACTION AGENDA IS UPDATED AND ADAPTED DURING THE PROJECT TIME PERIOD.

THIS PROJECT WILL ACCOMPLISH 5 TASKS: ANALYSIS, SYNTHESIS, AND REPORTING FOR PREVIOUSLY COLLECTED SKOKOMISH ESTUARY MONITORING DATA; AN ESTUARY EDUCATION AND OUTREACH COMPONENT FOR THE LOCAL COMMUNITY; ONGOING ESTUARY MONITORING; ECOSYSTEM COORDINATION BOARD TRIBAL REPRESENTATION; AND GRANT ADMINISTRATION.   NOTE THAT YOU MAY NOT DRAW DOWN FUNDS FOR INDIRECT COSTS WITHOUT A CURRENT, APPROVED RATE IN PLACE.

WORK PLAN ENTAILS ELWHA RIVER RESTORATION AND MONITORING ACTIVITIES INCLUDING DELTA BENTHIC DIVE SURVEYS, WESTERN PEARLSHELL MUSSEL MONITORING, VIABLE SALMONID POPULATION MONITORING, PORT ANGELES STREAMS WATER QUALITY MONITORING. ANOTHER TASK ENTAILS ELWHA RIVER WILDLIFE STUDIES OF RIVER-DEPENDENT WILDLIFE FOCUSING ON SHOREBIRD AND PISCIVOROUS BIRD STUDIES. TASK 4 INCLUDES TECHNICAL REVIEW AND SUPPORT OF THE PORT ANGELES HARBOR REMEDIAL INVESTIGATION AND FEASIBILITY STUDY AND ACTION PLAN DEVELOPMENT. TASK 5 INCLUDES ASSISTANCE TO NOAA FISHERIES MONITORING VIA BEACH SEINING.

COMPONENT 1 ENTAILS SAUK-SUIATTLE INDIAN TRIBE'S (SSIT) COORDINATING RIPARIAN HABITAT RESTORATION EFFORTS IN THE SKAGIT RIVER WATERSHED WITH THE ACTIONS OF THE PUGET SOUND PARTNERSHIP (PSP) ACTION AGENDA. TRIBAL REPRESENTATIVES WILL PARTICIPATE IN THE SKAGIT WATERSHED COUNCIL AND THE LEAD ENTITIES FOR SALMON RECOVERY IN WATER RESOURCE INVENTORY AREAS (WRIAS) 3 AND 4. ALSO, THIS ENTAILS KNOTWEED ERADICATION ON THE SAUK AND SKAGIT RIVERS. COMPONENT 2 INCLUDES THE SSIT FIELD AND WATER QUALITY COORDINATORS ACTIVITIES TO PLAN, SUPPORT, MANAGE, AND COORDINATE THE SSIT IMPLEMENTATION GRANTS.

THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT LOCAL AND REGIONAL RECOVERY STRATEGIES.  THE SUQUAMISH TRIBE WILL ENGAGE PLANS TO PROTECT ECOLOGICALLY IMPORTANT LANDS FROM DEVELOPMENT, INCLUDING RIPARIAN AREAS AND UPLAND FORESTLANDS THAT REFLECT THE SUQUAMISH TRIBE'S INTERESTS.  IT WILL ALSO GIVE CAPACITY TO PARTICIPATE IN THESE LOCAL AND REGIONAL PLANS, AND RESPONSE ACTIONS TO WATER QUALITY PROBLEMS.  THE TRIBE WILL CONTINUE TO WORK WITH OTHERS TO PROTECT SHELLFISH GROWING AREAS AND ADDRESS POLLUTION SOURCES THAT ARE A THREAT TO CURRENT GROWING AREAS IN THE PUGET SOUND AREA.

THIS GRANT ENABLES THE GRANTEE TO FACILITATE AND SUPPORT TRIBAL ENGAGEMENT IN PUGET SOUND MANAGEMENT CONFERENCE (MC) FORUMS (ECOSYSTEM COORDINATION BOARD, LEADERSHIP COUNCIL, AND TRIBAL MANAGEMENT CONFERENCE); INTEGRATE CRITICAL TRIBAL SALMONID MANAGEMENT DATA INTO MC SYSTEMS; SERVE IN LEADERSHIP ROLES IN PUGET SOUND SCIENCE AND TECHNICAL FORUMS; AND EFFECTIVELY MANAGE THIS GRANT.

FUNDING SUPPORTS 1) WRIA 1 WATERSHED MANAGEMENT BOARD ACTIVITIES BY TECHNICAL LOCAL SALMON RECOVERY, WATERSHED, FLOODPLAIN MANAGEMENT, ECOSYSTEM RECOVERY. 2) RESTORATION PROJECT PLANNING, DEVELOPMENT, MONITORING TO ENSURE ECOLOGICAL BASELINES MAINTAINED BY REVIEWING, COMMENTING ON PROPOSED LAND USE ACTIONS.  PROVIDE TECHNICAL INPUT INTO REGULATORY UPDATES/PLANS. 3) TREATY RESOURCE PROTECTION ENSURES ECOLOGICAL BASELINES MAINTAINED BY REVIEWING, COMMENTING ON PROPOSED LAND USE ACTIONS.

PROPOSAL HAS 2 COMPONENTS. COMPONENT 1: IMPLEMENT SKAGIT WATERSHED CHINOOK RECOVERY HABITAT POLICIES HAS GOAL OF ADVANCING THE TRIBE'S WORK TO IMPROVE AND EXPAND SPAWNING, REARING AND FORAGING HABITAT FOR CHINOOK SALMON RECOVERY BY PROMOTING HABITAT PROTECTION AND RESTORATION. COMPONENT 2: IMPLEMENT SHELLFISH CLIMATE CHANGE ADAPTATION STRATEGIES IS TO BUILD INTERNAL CAPACITY TO ASSESS CLIMATE CHANGE AND OCEAN ACIDIFICATION IMPACTS ON TRIBALLY-IMPORTANT SHELLFISH RESOURCES AND IMPLEMENT ADAPTATION STRATEGIES TO ENHANCE NEARSHORE FUNCTION AND RESILIENCE IN NORTHERN PUGET SOUND.

PROTECTION AND RESTORATION OF PUGET SOUND BY PROTECTING AND RESTORING SUSTAINABLE, HARVESTABLE, AND SAFE TO EAT SALMON AND SHELLFISH IN THE TRIBE'S USUAL AND ACCUSTOMED AREA WITH EMPHASIS ON SEQUIM BAY AND DUNGENESS BAY AND THE WATERSHEDS THAT DRAIN INTO THESE BAYS. THIS FUNDING WILL SUPPORT THE TRIBE'S TASK PRIORITIES: ADVANCE PUGET SOUND RECOVERY BY PARTICIPATING AND PROVIDING LEADERSHIP IN LOCAL AND REGIONAL FORUMS. ADVANCE SALMON RECOVERY THROUGH FLOODPLAIN RESTORATION BY PROVIDING LEADERSHIP AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT AND ADVANCE SHELLFISH RECOVERY BY PROVIDING LEADERSHIP, TECHNICAL AND SCIENTIFIC SUPPORT.

WORK ENTAILS LAKE SAMMAMISH PISCIVOROUS FISH SAMPLING TO ASSESS PRELIMINARY ABUNDANCE USING MARK-RECAPTURE TECHNIQUES AND DEVELOP DATABASE OF ABUNDANCE. DEVELOP MODELS TO ASSESS ABUNDANCE OF THESE SPECIES AND USE TROPHIC MODEL TO ESTIMATE SALMONID CONTRIBUTION TO PISCIVORE DIETS. DEVELOP BIOENERGETICS MODEL TO EXPLORE RANGE OF IMPACT INVASIVE PISCIVORES ARE HAVING ON SALMONID RELEASES. BUILD MATRIX MODEL TO EXPLORE MANAGEMENT OPTIONS FOR PISCIVORES IN THE BASIN. PREPARE REPORTS. ALSO, CONDUCT WALLEYE OTOLITH STUDY TO DETERMINE IF ORIGINATE IN OR OUTSIDE THE LAKE WASHINGTON BASIN

SAMISH INDIAN NATION DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (DNR) WILL CONTINUE THEIR WORK IN RESTORING THE SALISH SEA ECOSYSTEM.  THE WORKPLAN INCLUDES: STORMWATER POLLUTION IDENTIFICATION AND CORRECTION PROGRAM IN ANACORTES; EELGRASS MONITORING AND RESEARCH; BEACH SEINING TO DETERMINE FISH POPULATION USE IN FIDALGO BAY; EFFECTIVENESS MONITORING OF SECRET HARBOR SALTMARSH RESTORATION ON CYPRESS ISLAND; INDIGENOUS SCIENTIFIC KNOWLEDGE (TEK) GATHERING AND SHARING; AND DIRECTOR OF DNR PARTICIPATION IN THE PSEMP STEERING COMMITTEE.

THE WORK TO BE ACCOMPLISHED IN THIS PROJECT IS TO SERVE AS THE PUGET SOUND ACTION AGENDA TRIBAL IMPLEMENTATION LEAD, DEVELOPING AND CARRYING OUT A PROGRAM TO MAKE AND MANAGE SUBAWARDS TO IMPLEMENT HIGH TRIBAL PRIORITY WORK THAT IS IDENTIFIED IN OR CONSISTENT WITH THE PUGET SOUND ACTION AGENDA.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE SUB-AWARDS TO 19 FEDERALLY-RECOGNIZED PUGET SOUND TRIBES, AND CONSORTIA OF THESE TRIBES, TO IMPLEMENT PROJE
